item.title: Design by Contract supported by tests
item.description: In this post I’m going to describe a testing technique that I often find superior to mocking and stubbing. Contract test’s and lightweight implementations applies to all level of testing, but in this post im going to describe it in the context of unit testing where i personally use it a lot to define and verify the behavior of an API. The concept of a Contract Test is not new. I first read a about it in the “JUnit recipies” book sometime during the last decade, although the author didn’t define them as Contract Tests back then, but rather a teqnique for testing abstract types (abstract classes and interfaces in Java).

I’m a software developer working in the financial industry in Stockholm, Sweden. I’m a big proponent of test driven development, although i try to avoid being dogmatic. I don’t think there’s one true way to develop software. Different styles suit different needs. Whether a given practice is appealing is highly subjective. For me, TDD really helps me in many of my everyday programming tasks. I will probably write a fair amount of posts about how I do TDD.
